trans-unit.source: Sets the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified

seg-source.mrk: Sets the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified

target.mrk: Sets the date and time that a file was created, accessed and modified

trans-unit.source: Handle to the file. The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the FILE_WRITE_ATTRIBUTES access right.

seg-source.mrk: The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the FILE_WRITE_ATTRIBUTES access right.

target.mrk: The file handle must have been created using the CreateFile function with the FILE_WRITE_ATTRIBUTES access right.

trans-unit.source: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was created.

seg-source.mrk: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was created.

target.mrk: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was created.

trans-unit.source: This be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

seg-source.mrk: This be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

target.mrk: This be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

trans-unit.source: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last accessed.

seg-source.mrk: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last accessed.

target.mrk: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last accessed.

trans-unit.source: The last access time includes the last time the file was written to, read from, or (in the case of executable files) run.

seg-source.mrk: The last access time includes the last time the file was written to, read from, or (in the case of executable files) run.

target.mrk: The last access time includes the last time the file was written to, read from, or (in the case of executable files) run.

trans-unit.source: This can be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

seg-source.mrk: This can be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

target.mrk: This can be 0 if the application does not need to set this information.

trans-unit.source: To preserve the existing last access time for a file even after accessing a file, call SetFileTime with this parameter set to -1 before closing the file handle.

seg-source.mrk: To preserve the existing last access time for a file even after accessing a file, call SetFileTime with this parameter set to -1 before closing the file handle.

target.mrk: To preserve the existing last access time for a file even after accessing a file, call SetFileTime with this parameter set to -1 before closing the file handle.

trans-unit.source: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last written to.

seg-source.mrk: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last written to.

target.mrk: a $tagFILETIME structure that contains the new date and time the file was last written to.

trans-unit.source: This can be 0 if the application does not want to set this information.

seg-source.mrk: This can be 0 if the application does not want to set this information.

target.mrk: This can be 0 if the application does not want to set this information.

trans-unit.source: Not all file systems can record creation and last access times and not all file systems record them in the same manner.

seg-source.mrk: Not all file systems can record creation and last access times and not all file systems record them in the same manner.

target.mrk: Not all file systems can record creation and last access times and not all file systems record them in the same manner.

trans-unit.source: For example, on FAT, create time has a resolution of 10 milliseconds, write time has a resolution of 2 seconds, and access time has a resolution of 1 day (really, the access date). Therefore, the _Date_Time_GetFileTime() function may not return the same file time information set using _Date_Time_SetFileTime().

seg-source.mrk: For example, on FAT, create time has a resolution of 10 milliseconds, write time has a resolution of 2 seconds, and access time has a resolution of 1 day (really, the access date).
Therefore, the _Date_Time_GetFileTime() function may not return the same file time information set using _Date_Time_SetFileTime().

target.mrk: For example, on FAT, create time has a resolution of 10 milliseconds, write time has a resolution of 2 seconds, and access time has a resolution of 1 day (really, the access date).
Therefore, the _Date_Time_GetFileTime() function may not return the same file time information set using _Date_Time_SetFileTime().

trans-unit.source: NTFS delays updates to the last access time for a file by up to one hour after the last access.

seg-source.mrk: NTFS delays updates to the last access time for a file by up to one hour after the last access.

target.mrk: NTFS delays updates to the last access time for a file by up to one hour after the last access.

target.mrk: Create test file and set file times
